snippet: Professional risk analysts have alarming warnings about the year and decade ahead, including growing income disparity, economic turmoil, global warming, cyberattacks and disruptions in the water supply.
abstract: World Economic Forum says severe income disparity and chronic fiscal imbalances are the top two risks facing business leaders and policy makers in 2012 and over the next decade; highlights other risks including global warming and cyberattacks.
lead_paragraph: Professional risk analysts have alarming warnings about the year and decade ahead, including growing income disparity, economic turmoil, global warming, cyberattacks and disruptions in the water supply.

headline.seo: Income Gap and Fiscal Inequity Pose Top Risks in 2012, Economic Forum Finds
headline.main: Economic Troubles Cited As the Top Risks in 2012
headline.print_headline: Economic Troubles Cited As the Top Risks in 2012
